name: Avatar

jtbd.functional: Represent a person or entity visually. Display a profile image, initials fallback, or placeholder icon at consistent sizes.
jtbd.affordance: Circular image or initials on a colored background. Users immediately recognize this as representing a person. Size variants communicate hierarchy (small in lists, large in profiles).
jtbd.emotional: Humanizes the interface. Seeing a face or initials creates personal connection and trust.

anatomy.avatar: .t-avatar — Circular container with overflow hidden, flex-centered for initials
anatomy.initials: .t-avatar > span — Text initials fallback when no image
anatomy.group: .t-avatar-group — Overlapping row of avatars with negative margin

content.initials: Text node inside .t-avatar — fallback when no image available.

accessibility.ariaLabel: Must have alt text on img or aria-label on container describing the person
accessibility.screenReader: Image alt or aria-label announces person's name. Group announces count.
accessibility.decorative: If avatar is purely decorative (next to visible name), use alt='' or aria-hidden='true'

knownIssues: No loading/skeleton state for image loading
No error fallback when image fails to load (requires JS)
Avatar group overlap uses negative margin — may cause layout issues in flex containers
futureConsiderations: Image error fallback to initials (requires JS)
